exercises.example_sentence: The decision is yours to make.

exercises.question: After an hour of ___, we finally decided on a location for the picnic.
exercises.hint: A conversation about something specifically
exercises.example_sentence: The board had a long discussion about the budget.

exercises.question: I am ___ satisfied with the results of the project.
exercises.hint: Totally; utterly
exercises.example_sentence: I completely forgot about the meeting.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about public health.
exercises.answer: the promotion of healthy food is very important
exercises.hint: Subject (The + Noun + of + etc) + be + Adjective
exercises.example_sentence: The promotion of healthy food is very important.

exercises.question: Match the adverbs and nouns to similar words.
exercises.hint: Emphasis and communication
exercises.example_sentence: The discussion was totally helpful.

exercises.question: It is a family ___ to open one gift on Christmas Eve.
exercises.hint: A long-established custom or belief
exercises.example_sentence: Every country has its own unique tradition.

exercises.question: What was the ___ of the research paper you read?
exercises.hint: Review: The end or finish of an event or process
exercises.example_sentence: The conclusion was that we need more research.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about someone's appearance.
exercises.answer: she always has a kind expression on her face
exercises.hint: Subject + Adverb + Verb + etc
exercises.example_sentence: She always has a kind expression on her face.

exercises.question: Say 'tradition'. Stress the second syllable.
exercises.hint: An old custom
exercises.example_sentence: We follow this tradition every year.

exercises.question: Effective ___ is the most important part of running a successful business.
exercises.hint: Review: The process of controlling things or people
exercises.example_sentence: Project management is a valuable skill.

exercises.question: The building's ___ was very strong despite the earthquake.
exercises.hint: Review: The lowest load-bearing part of a building
exercises.example_sentence: A good foundation is key to a stable house.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about a new job.
exercises.answer: this job is a wonderful opportunity for your career
exercises.hint: Subject + be + Adjective + Noun + etc
exercises.example_sentence: This job is a wonderful opportunity for your career.

exercises.question: He has ten years of ___ in the automotive industry.
exercises.hint: Review: Practical contact with facts or events
exercises.example_sentence: Experience is more important than a degree sometimes.

exercises.question: Match the nouns to their related concepts.
exercises.hint: Career and growth
exercises.example_sentence: Take every chance to gain more experience.

exercises.question: What was her ___ when she saw the surprise party?
exercises.hint: Review: An action performed in response to a situation
exercises.example_sentence: His reaction was very emotional.

exercises.question: China has the second largest ___ in the world today.
exercises.hint: Review: The total number of people in a place
exercises.example_sentence: Rural population is decreasing in some countries.

exercises.question: The police gave clear ___ on how to exit the stadium safely after the match.
exercises.hint: A course along which someone or something moves
exercises.example_sentence: We are moving in the right direction.

exercises.question: Is there a stable internet ___ in this hotel room?
exercises.hint: A relationship in which two or more things are linked or associated
exercises.example_sentence: I have a poor connection on my phone.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about improvement.
exercises.answer: the situation is getting better every day
exercises.hint: Subject + be + verb+ing + Adjective + Time phrase
exercises.example_sentence: The situation is getting better every day.

exercises.question: Match the nouns to their synonyms or related terms.
exercises.hint: Relating to paths and bonds
exercises.example_sentence: This link provides a connection to the way forward.

exercises.question: Say 'direction'. Focus on the 'rec' syllable.
exercises.hint: The path you follow
exercises.example_sentence: Which direction should I go?

exercises.question: She had a happy ___ on her face when she saw the surprise.
exercises.hint: The look on someone's face
exercises.example_sentence: His expression was one of confusion.

exercises.question: What is your ___ in the new company you joined?
exercises.hint: A person's place or rank in an organization
exercises.example_sentence: He holds a high position in the firm.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about resolution.
exercises.answer: we reached a final decision after the meeting
exercises.hint: Subject + Verb + Object + Time phrase
exercises.example_sentence: We reached a final decision after the meeting.

exercises.question: Match the nouns to their related synonyms in a professional context.
exercises.hint: Appearances and hierarchies
exercises.example_sentence: His rank gave him a new position.

exercises.question: Review: The ___ decided to build a new library in the town center.
exercises.hint: Review: The leaders of a country
exercises.example_sentence: The government is improving the schools.

exercises.question: Thank you for your active ___ in our local workshop.
exercises.hint: The action of taking part in something
exercises.example_sentence: Participation is key to learning.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about career goals.
exercises.answer: she is hoping for a promotion this year
exercises.hint: Subject + be + verb+ing + for + etc
exercises.example_sentence: She is hoping for a promotion this year.

exercises.question: Review: It is not ___ to buy an expensive car if you don't travel often.
exercises.hint: Review: Essential or required
exercises.example_sentence: Is it necessary to wait?

exercises.question: The manager is not ___ right now, but he will be free later.
exercises.hint: Review: Free to be seen or used
exercises.example_sentence: This feature is not available yet.

exercises.question: Say 'participation'. Clear 'sh' sound at the end.
exercises.hint: Taking part in an activity
exercises.example_sentence: Thank you for your participation.

exercises.question: Review: I need a detailed ___ of the man who stole your bag.
exercises.hint: Review: A representation of how something looks
exercises.example_sentence: The description was very helpful.

exercises.question: We went to the restaurant for my brother's ___ party.
exercises.hint: The receiving of an academic degree
exercises.example_sentence: I hope to see you at graduation.

exercises.question: Match the nouns to their related concepts.
exercises.hint: Finish and facts
exercises.example_sentence: Details help make a better description.

exercises.question: Review: The ___ are working to improve the company's profit.
exercises.hint: Review: The leaders of a business
exercises.example_sentence: Management is hard but rewarding.

exercises.question: He has ten years of ___ in the field of education.
exercises.hint: Review: Knowledge or skill from doing something
exercises.example_sentence: Experience is the best teacher.

exercises.question: The meeting ended with a short ___ about the new project deadlines.
exercises.hint: A conversation or debate about a specific topic
exercises.example_sentence: We had a lively discussion during the class.

exercises.question: The museum has a wonderful ___ of ancient Greek statues.
exercises.hint: A group of things that have been collected together
exercises.example_sentence: He has a collection of rare stamps.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about clothing and culture.
exercises.answer: she is wearing a traditional dress for the wedding
exercises.hint: Subject + be + verb+ing + Adjective + Noun + etc
exercises.example_sentence: She is wearing a traditional dress for the wedding.

exercises.question: Match the nouns to their related synonyms or similar concepts.
exercises.hint: Talking and groups
exercises.example_sentence: A long chat is a type of discussion.

exercises.question: Say 'discussion'. Focus on the 'ssion' sound.
exercises.hint: Talking about a topic
exercises.example_sentence: The discussion was very informative.

exercises.question: Review: Studying classic ___ is a major part of the English course.
exercises.hint: Review: Written works of art
exercises.example_sentence: I like reading Russian literature.

exercises.question: The increase in temperature was quite ___ this summer.
exercises.hint: Review: Great or important enough to be worthy of attention
exercises.example_sentence: There was a significant change in the weather.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about learning goals.
exercises.answer: it is a wonderful opportunity to learn a new language
exercises.hint: Subject + be + Adjective + Noun + infinitive phrase
exercises.example_sentence: It is a wonderful opportunity to learn a new language.

exercises.question: Match the review words to their related synonyms.
exercises.hint: Review items
exercises.example_sentence: A big chance is a significant opportunity.

exercises.question: Review: I think $30 is a ___ price for this good quality bag.
exercises.hint: Review: Fair and sensible
exercises.example_sentence: The price was quite reasonable.

exercises.question: I had a long ___ with my friend about which movie to watch.
exercises.hint: Review: An exchange of diverging views
exercises.example_sentence: We had an argument about politics.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about comparison.
exercises.answer: there is no difference between the two products
exercises.hint: There + be + Noun + Preposition + etc
exercises.example_sentence: There is no difference between the two products.

exercises.question: Say 'significant'. Focus on the 'fi' syllable.
exercises.hint: Being important
exercises.example_sentence: This is a significant discovery.

exercises.question: Review: Please follow the ___ to build the table correctly.
exercises.hint: Review: Directions or orders
exercises.example_sentence: Read the instruction carefully.

exercises.question: My ___ is very kind and always helps me water my plants.
exercises.hint: Review: A person living next door
exercises.example_sentence: My neighbor has a lovely garden.

exercises.question: Order the sentence about consensus.
exercises.answer: he finally reached an agreement with the company
exercises.hint: Subject + Adverb + Verb + Object + Preposition + etc
exercises.example_sentence: He finally reached an agreement with the company.

exercises.question: The damage to the car was ___, so he had to buy a new one.
exercises.hint: Review: Lasting or intended to last or remain unchanged indefinitely
exercises.example_sentence: She has a permanent job now.

exercises.question: Match the people to their usual locations.
exercises.hint: Review item
exercises.example_sentence: My neighbor lives in the house next door.

exercises.question: Review: What was his ___ when he found out he got the job?
exercises.hint: Review: Response to a situation
exercises.example_sentence: His reaction was one of pure joy.

exercises.question: We are having a big ___ for my parents' 50th anniversary.
exercises.hint: Review: A social gathering for a special occasion
exercises.example_sentence: The celebration was a huge success.
